review.description: Delicious vodka sauce.  Been coming here for years.  They used to serve 1/2 portions, but now the pasta is only one size and the portions some how decreased.  Nonetheless, flavorful Italian food. The staff and owner are very friendly.
review.author: Citi G.

review.description: The atmosphere was nice and the service was satisfactory. When I walked in, I didn't know there was a host because he was on the phone sitting on a bar. He seated me while still on the phone...so that was weird. My basket of bread consisted of rosemary bread and pieces of old pizza. Also weird. The crab ravioli was acceptable. Crab was fresh and sauce was average.
review.author: Melane M.

review.description: I love Caffe Buon Gusto's food and order it fairly often. However, they get at least one out of every three orders wrong, either sending the wrong thing or forgetting items entirely. We have called many times to get a refund, exchange an item, or try to recover something they forgot to give us, and are rarely successful. All in all, it's good food, but don't get too attached to your order.
review.author: Amanda M.

review.description: Impressively bad.  My friend and I, who both have worked as waiters, had planned a relaxing brunch in the sunshine, were left gobsmacked by how these folks managed to mess up our time there. Our Australian waiter was impatient and rude. Then after lowering himself to take our order, we didnt see him again for the ENTIRE meal. Impressive. The hostess started clearing our bread and olive oil while we were still eating. On her third attempt I pointed out that I still had a knife and fork in my hand, so she finally took the hint. The food was average, considering the price.    We went to nearby Armandos Italian restaurant for a glass of wine to get away from Buon Gusto, and received a warm welcome and courteous service.  Impressively bad.
review.author: Sean D.

review.description: Good happy hour deals but older crowd...I have been here for lunch and dinner. Whatever you do, do not get the pumpkin ravioli. It was super sweet, like a dessert. My friend enjoyed her eggplant dish though. It's always a miss for me when I go here so I don't plan to be back anytime soon.
review.author: Ola F.

review.description: Service is overbearing, too many people doing too many things and no one person is in charge of one table. Calamari was almost flavorless. Chicken parm's was cheesy, but the sauce tasted like just plain ripe tomatoes without any seasoning and the chicken wasn't even crispy. Everything needed pepper, but it didn't seem to help. Tiramisu was good and fluffly, but almost felt like they didn't use the raw cocoa powder on top, which made it bland too. I would call it Caffe Bland Gusto.
review.author: Corey M.

review.description:
Wonderful restaurant. 

I called beforehand to make sure I could bring my puppy with me as long as we sat in the outdoor seating area. They said absolutely--they couldn't wait to see me. 

I arrived for my reservation (I didn't really need one, but they gave me one anyway so I would have an outdoor table) early, and they greeted me by name and exclaimed over my puppy. My waitress Alice sat me at a corner table and immediately brought over a water bowl for my baby and a glass of water for me, and fussed over my little guy.

Long story short: service was wonderful, food was delicious, and I will be going back!

Oh, and get the lasagne--absolutely AH-mazing! And the prices are really great, too.
review.author: Dawn F.

review.description:
One of the...if not...the WORST restaurant in terms of delivery. I've dined in here before and it was so so. I would return. But after placing a delivery order, I have never wanted to scream at someone so badly and will NEVER eat here or order delivery again. After placing a delivery order 45 minutes later (expected) my order came and was wrong. Completely wrong. Wrong sauce - added meat (and I'm a vegetarian). Double checked my order and I placed it correctly. Called the restaurant to which the bartender could not find the manager so was going to put me on the phone with a buss boy (I don't know why) until I said I will till she found a manager. Then I spoke to a manager who didn't understand a word I said. Literally repeated my address five times. Then surprisingly the same delivery boy shows up (over an hour  after I've placed my order)....has no idea what orders he currently has in his hands...tries to hand me off someone else's order...doesn't even have my order in one of his bags...then I call the restaurant back...the manager claims someone is on their way...I tell him I'm extremely frustrated (which is takes a lot for me to complain or even leave a review!!!) and I tell him this is ridiculous and I expect a refund or something to be compensated for this...to which he then HANGS UP ON ME!!!!

I work in the service bizz too and I expect things to go wrong or take a while...but if you're not nice and don't give respect to your customers...let alone hang up on them!! How are you a manager?!? Still have not received my food......and now I'm afraid to eat it in fear they will spit in it!!!!

WORST delivery experience in my life. RIDICULOUS!


Now an hour and half later my food finally shows up....and nothing. No refund. Zip. NADA!
review.author: K E.

review.description:
Right in the middle of brooklyn heights, you can't miss this place. 

the service is great and friendly. we try to sit out in the front when we have a chance but indoor sitting is still pleasant.

you can't go wrong with their pastas and a good bottle of wine!
review.author: Helen L.

review.description: This place is located in my favorite neighborhood in the world and I have been going there since it opened. Food has always been great and is still on point. The problem is the prices are crazy and portions have been reduced to almost tapas size. My major gripe is the pasta dishes and this will always get me when we all know that a pound of pasta for the average consumer could be under $1. So a restaurant buying in bulk is probably getting for half that and giving you a fraction of the pound and charging as much as they do is a bit ridiculous. The deserts are also great, but also have become bite-size.
review.author: John D.

review.description: Not certain on the food but the bar is nice and the staff (this is important to me) is super! Great place for a happy hour it's 2 for 1. Can't beat that!
review.author: Rich R.

review.description: Came here for dinner with one of my girlfriends-this is her favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn Heights. Honestly, the only thing memorable about this place for me was the tiramisu (delicious!). Food was good as well.
review.author: Ana B.

review.description: Went there friday night with a large group food was ok service is horrible . Heres a tip when u have a large group you may want to keep pitchers of water on the table especially when you refused to give us new glasses. We had a preset menu 3 courses apps, entree and desert. We brought a cake so i guess they thought we didnt get the desert we paid for. Never served it and started a bar tab rather then have the guests pay for there own drinks like we had told them leaving the poor woman who put the party together to pay the extra $$$$. The seating was a nightmare all in itself. Party of our party was on the opposite side of the restaurant by themselves. If you cant accommodate our requests do not take the party. The waitresses were cold and unpleasant and seriously should not be working in this industry !!!!!
review.author: Nicole M.

review.description: Unfortunately this is Pretty subpar Italian food. I had high hopes, but my fiancee's lobster linguini was uninspired, it was edible but just not very good. I have to agree about the Eggplant Rollantine- very cheesy but quite bland. It's doubtful we will eat here again, given all superior Italian cuisine around.
review.author: Tara K.

review.description:
GREAT service, the manager or owner is very nice to each customer and attentive to everyone's needs. Their food is also pretty high end (NOT diner quality.) I had melons with prosciutto, which came with long and thick (haha) slices of hard (ha) parmesan cheese. I also created my own omelet. I forgot what I put in it. Goat cheese, a meat and a veggie I believe. It was delicious. 

They have pretty good drinks too. The atmosphere of the place is great. It's very clean and high end looking on the inside and there's plenty of outdoor seating as well. It's on a nice, clean and quiet street in a very relaxed neighborhood.

I couldn't think many better places to hang out at all day on a nice spring day.
review.author: Bobby C.

review.description:
Tip: when you have clearly forgotten someone's meal, and you come back 1.5 hours after they order to ask if they like their food (oops! we have none!), the best way to appease your customers is not to tell them that a large group entered the restaurant just after them. It's not the large group's fault. It's the restaurant's fault. 

Also - food was bad. And cold. And bad.
review.author: Michelle M.

review.description: The food at Caffe Buon Gusto is so good that it makes me wonder why I wasted so much money and appetite at the now defunct, Ristorante La Traviata for so many years. This is real, old school Italian. White table cloths, Frank Sinatra and Louis Prima crooning through the speakers and the entire staff speaks with different lovely accents. I'm hooked on the breadbasket which has three types of bread (soft, crusty, tomato-y) and the EVOO for dipping makes it all taste magical. The lobster ravioli is divine. Crab cake appetizers are good, not scrumptious but still nice to have on the table as a starter. Tonight I ate the Pagla e Fieno shrimp. I asked the waitress to have the chef kick it up a notch. He did so with perfection and my shrimps were also big and cooked just right. I could've used just a bit more pasta to soak up all the spicy, red sauce but this is not a complaint because I like my pasta saucy! Please note that Caffe Buon Gusto is authentic Italian cooking, so the pasta is extremely al dente. It is in fact so al dente, that you can almost feel it crunch between your teeth. If crunchy pasta is not your thing, pass that info to your server and the chef will prepare it to your liking. I didn't have any room for dessert tonight but I have had the Tiramisu on another occasion and it's very good. There's a bar at the front  where a few of the after work crowd in suits, watches sports. There's also a brunch menu I'd like to explore.
review.author: Tanya R.

review.description:
The pear and gargonzolo salad, and the Prosciutto with melon were both divine. 

The charming man who I presumed was the owner is old school charming and suave. He sure knows how to make patrons feel welcome. My friend and I had only been here once before, but he remembered us and made our whole dining experience so lovely. If you're near Montague, check this place out!
review.author: Caitlin M.

review.description: Went there randomly, and found a very good Italian restaurant : we enjoyed dining outside, the staff is friendly, and the food very good. I had the Vongole Pasta, which were to me exactly how I they should be : high quality clams and very discrete dressing. We even were offered a delicious slice of cake for desert!
review.author: Nicolas R.

review.description:
I called in for delivery to this place and got the Black Linguine Calamari.  Maybe it's because I did delivery, but my squid inked pasta was rather soggy, not that al dente that I've been accustomed to at every Italian place.

The calamari was really tender, and the sauce was really flavorful, but the pasta kinda killed it.  I have nothing against this place, though, and I want to try it in person to see if this pasta problem persists.  Will report back soon!
review.author: Minh L.
